intro: Erlangea schebellensis, commonly known as the Schebell's erlangia, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and some toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
